title: Pitch angle resolved ECT-HOPE science data.  Electron fluxes ~15-50,000 eV, ion fluxes ~1-50,000 eV. Electrons and ions measured in alternate spin cadence.  - Herbert Funsten (Los Alamos National Laboratory)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch_Ion' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/rbsp/rbspa/l3/ect/hope/pitchangle/rel04/2012/rbspa_rel04_ect-hope-pa-l3_20121025_v7.1.0.cdf. The most common cadence occurred for 47.3668% of the 1556 timesteps. Cadence = 24346 [ms] = PT24.346S.
info.contact: Herbert Funsten @ Los Alamos National Laboratory

parameters.name: FPDO
parameters.description: FPDO: Omnidirectional differential Proton flux ~1-50,000 eV

parameters.name: FPDO_T
parameters.description: ---> (stacked time series; perigees excluded). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_esa_qflag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['FPDO', 'Mode_Ion']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: FPDU
parameters.description: FPDU: Unidirectional Differential Proton Flux ~1-50,000 eV, in 72 energy and 11 pitch angle bins (energy-angle displays)

parameters.name: FPDU_byE_atA
parameters.description: ---> Spectrograms by energy at sample pitch angles. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['FPDU']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
parameters.x_cdf_DISPLAY_TYPE: bar_charty=HOPE_ENERGY_Ion, z=FPDU_byE_atA(1,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(2,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(3,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(4,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(5,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(6,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(7,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(8,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(9,*),  z=FPDU_byE_atA(10,*), z=FPDU_byE_atA(11,*)

parameters.name: FPDU_byA_atE
parameters.description: ---> Spectrograms by pitch angle at sample energies (perigees excluded). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_esa_qflag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['FPDU', 'Mode_Ion']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
parameters.x_cdf_DISPLAY_TYPE: bar_charty=PITCH_ANGLE,z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,1), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,6), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,11),z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,16), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,21), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,26), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,31), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,36), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,41), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,46), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,51), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,56), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,61), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,66), z=FPDU_byA_atE(*,72)

parameters.name: B_Calc_Ion
parameters.description: ---> Model magnetic field strength (ion timebase)

parameters.name: B_Eq_Ion
parameters.description: ---> Model magnetic field strength at magnetic equator (ion timebase)

parameters.name: I_Ion
parameters.description: ---> Adiabatic invariant (bounce) (ion timebase)

parameters.name: L_Ion
parameters.description: ---> Calculated McIlwains L parameter (ion timebase)

parameters.name: L_star_Ion
parameters.description: ---> Calculated Roederers L* parameter (ion timebase)

parameters.name: MLT_Ion
parameters.description: ---> Calculated Magnetic Local Time (ion timebase)

parameters.name: Position_Ion
parameters.description: ---> Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates (ion timebase)

parameters.name: Position_Ion_TT
parameters.description: [Labels on plots] Position of the satellite in geographic coordinates (ion). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['Position_Ion']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_Calc_Ion_TT
parameters.description: ---> Calculated magnetic field strength (ion). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_Calc_Ion']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: B_Eq_Ion_TT
parameters.description: ---> Calculated magnetic field strength at magnetic equator(ion). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['B_Eq_Ion']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: L_Ion_TT
parameters.description: ---> Calculated McIlwains L parameter (Earths radii, ion). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['L_Ion']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: I_Ion_TT
parameters.description: ---> Adiabatic invariant (bounce, ion). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['I_Ion']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: MLT_Ion_TT
parameters.description: ---> Calculated Magnetic Local Time (hours, ion). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['MLT_Ion'].
